intro: Codonopsis convolvulacea, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has oval, dark green leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in Chinese medicine. The flowers bloom in summer, adding a striking visual element to gardens and natural habitats.
